description: In “Deepsea Challenge 3D,” James Cameron dives into a documentary project that’s autobiographical.
title: James Cameron Takes Viewers on ‘Deepsea Challenge 3D’
title_page: James Cameron Takes Viewers on ‘Deepsea Challenge 3D’ - The New York Times
maintext:
DEEPSEA CHALLENGE 3D
Opens on Friday
Directed by John Bruno, Andrew Wight and Ray Quint
1 hour 30 minutes
James Cameron upstages the ocean in “Deepsea Challenge 3D,” a shallow vanity project that invites us to join him in marveling at his own daring.
Image James Cameron as an explorer in his craft. Credit... Mark Thiessen/National Geographic
Certainly, who among us would strap ourselves into what looks like a giant green thumb drive and sink, alone, to the bottom of the Mariana Trench? But with eight deepwater expeditions under his belt, Mr. Cameron hardly needs his wife, Suzy Amis Cameron, earnestly popping up here to reaffirm his explorer bona fides. And by 2012, having spent seven years helping him to design and build the submersible known as the Deepsea Challenger, his team of scientists and engineers (only a few of whom get a word in edgewise) is more than ready to drop him 36,000 feet below sea level.
